column3: is a 4th class component city in the province of Misamis Occidental
column6: 011 people.The city was formerly called Regidor until 1930 when it was given its current name.

column1: Tangub is located on the northern shores of Panguil Bay.
Tangub is politically subdivided into 55 barangays.

column3: is a regular participant of the Sinulog Festival
column4: a festival held in Cebu City. This festival is the pageantry of sights

column7: the child Jesus. The highlights of the festival is from January 9–18

column2: Tangub has been popularly dubbed as the Christmas Symbols Capital of the Philippines.

column1: Tangub City has its own festival - Dalit Festival. It is in honor of the city's patron saint
column2: Saint Michael the Archangel. It is celebrated every 29 September-the feast day of St. Michael. It is participated by the city's baranggays through clusters represented by local schools.
